website_summaries.verdict: Although it may not work on heavy-duty tilling tasks, it's an affordable electric option that can handle most basic to mid-level gardening and cultivating jobs.
pros: Delivers 12 amps of power, which is practical for most home garden needs
Cultivates paths 16 inches wide and down to 8 inches deep
cons: Very hard soil and tough, thick grass have the tendency to challenge it a bit
Some issues with wobbly tires noted

website_summaries.verdict: This tiller is good for lightweight tilling and aerating of the soil.
pros: A good product to help out a compacted lawn
Folding handle means less storage space
Does not feel flimsy when it is in use
Can cut through the soil well
Wheels can operate in 3 positions for depth
Good for mixing in new soil or mulch
cons: There is not a variable speed on this model

website_summaries.verdict: Acceptable for gardeners who need reliable power, but the wheels could be better.
pros: Affordable 12-amp model does a great job at breaking through most types of soil
Tough, yet lightweight and easy to use
cons: Wheels have been known to wobble and even fall off
Customer service could be more attentive

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got the upper end and not the 6
customer_reviews.text: The 12 amps makes the difference pulled up large rocks and cut through grass and weed roots as well. Glad I got the upper end and not the 6.5 and 8 amp models.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Miller

customer_reviews.title: really nice tiller. light
customer_reviews.text: really nice tiller. light,easy to use, it's a little powerhouse, great for small gardens. I wouldn't recommend it for big jobs. my vegetable garden is about 20 by 35, it is a perfect tiller for something around that size.
customer_reviews.author: ned j. augustyniak

customer_reviews.title: Worst of all
customer_reviews.text: Cons: 1. Not for hard soil. This could not come close to breaking up our Wyoming soil. 2. Holding handle to keep it going gets tiring. Especially since it won't dig down in and just bounces most of the time. 3. Going over the ground 6 times and it still barely made it 4 inches. The ground was still clumpy as well. 4. Worst of all: we went to unplug it and it was so tight we couldn't get it off. When we finally did get it off the one prong stayed in the extension cord. 5. We have a tiller that never worked very good, but definitely won't work now after just one season. Tilling just one garden plot.
customer_reviews.author: Orvin C. Jenks

customer_reviews.title: Two gardening seasons and still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I have a pretty large vegetable garden and used to break my back turning soil with a shovel or using a heavy unmanageable gas powered rototiller. This tiller is electric and so light you can lift it with one hand! The electric motor has torque like a Tesla and just eats through my soil, even after being densely packed by winter snows. I mix in peat moss with ease and even sand for my tomatoes. The only downside is that you do need a cord to reach your garden from a regular AC outlet. I'm looking forward to another spring with this valuable helper.
customer_reviews.author: William G

customer_reviews.title: Durable electric tiller
customer_reviews.text: Durable light duty unit with expected short-comings: light weight on front (impacts tilling depth), one speed operation (it’s either in or off), maneuverability. Likes: tough motor, transmission, and casing Dislikes: handle design - limits maneuvering, makes it difficult to hold, not as rugged as rest of tiller.
customer_reviews.author: A cannon

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressive
customer_reviews.text: We are very impressed with the Sun Joe tiller. Its well priced and very effective. We had to till parts of our yard that had a lot of stones in it and Sun Joe handled them well. It "crawled" over large ones we couldn't see without causing any issues. It did not throw any of the other stones around at all and as we removed them, it really did a great job even though our soil was very hard. Then we put some good soil on top and it mixed it in very well. Actually can't believe something in that price range worked so well. Generous, full coverage warranty as well. Easy to use and store because it folds up.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This thing is AWESOME! I'm using it to till the side of ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME! I'm using it to till the side of my home. For being electric it has a lot of power! Like another review mentioned, it helps to zip-tie or hose clamp the handles at the connections to reduce vibration and kick. I was able to do this section on the side of my house with full grass and Indiana soil in about an hour. So far it has not even hesitated with tiny bits of gravel and assorted rocks mixed in. The clip for the cord is very handy and assembling it was a 3 minute process! I could not be happier with my purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Randy Slaughter

customer_reviews.title: Assembled fine. Started on garden
customer_reviews.text: Assembled fine. Started on garden. It only took 10 minutes for gearbox to fail. Sounds like a design flaw to me, I don't trust it. Too bad, I love electric tools. Packaging still on floor where it was unpacked. Product being returned. Maybe I will just go and rent one.
customer_reviews.author: Pat McC

customer_reviews.title: Good tiller for light or loose soils
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was very easy. This tiller has plenty of power. Its blades rotate frontward, so it tries to drive away from the operator in use instead of just digging vertically into the dirt. Surprisingly it is not equipped with a drag bar that would tend to hold it in place, so the only thing keeping it from driving away is the operator's arm strength. It is a great tiller for maintaining an existing garden, which is the purpose for which I bought it. But anyone using this to break new ground in stiff soils better have very strong arms and plenty of stamina.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Had 500 sq ft of sod that was arriving a week sooner than expected. Had considered renting one but we plan to set up a vegetable garden at some point in the future. This tiller could be delivered in time and had decent reviews. Arrived in time, took minutes to set up and I was tilling away. Did a great job and quickly. At one point we had a torrential rain and it was about 10 minutes before I realized the tiller had not been put away. I ran out and brought it in...it started up fine the next day. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Matty

customer_reviews.title: It’s alright for an electric roto tiller.  I’d probably buy a gas model.
customer_reviews.text: It was super easy to assemble. It doesn’t turn very well so it’s often annoying to turn around. It’s also difficult to maneuver to the place where you’re tilling because the wheels arent spectacular. It’s a basic corded roto tiller. You can use it to dig up like 5-6 inches of soil. The extension cord tends to disconnect during use sometimes. I found that annoying but not overly problematic. The big con on this is that any roots or grass or plants that are encountered are quickly tangled up in the tiller and super hard to remove. I spent more time removing tangled weeds than I spent tilling soil.
customer_reviews.author: Mr and Mrs Up

customer_reviews.title: Not good for roots
customer_reviews.text: This was a pain in the ass to assemble. It may seem easy but it was hard to tell which parts go where. It’s not exactly light weight but I guess not too heavy. There is no guards that come with the blades and someone actually bumped it and cut their foot. It gets caught in every weed and root in the ground. It’s very hard to use on ground that has not been pre loosened. It’s kind of annoying to worry about a cord attached to it while cutting with blades. Overall an okay product but we could of found something better suited for our project
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely in love with this
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tiller. I expected poor performance - boy was I wrong. This thing is beast, and the best part is I don't have to get it cranked up first. Simply plug it in and off we go. Be advised - you need a heavy duty drop cord with lighted connections to operate this. Make sure to order a cord along with the machine - using an undersized cord will cause premature motor failure.
customer_reviews.author: His Little Angel

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a tiller to start a garden but they are always to expensive. I found the Sun Joe and since the reviews were good I decided to make the leap and buy a tiller. I am so glad I did, this little thing works like a charm, it may not be as fast as a gas powered tiller but it gets the job done. It’s light and easy to move around, and goes through the dirt like nobody’s business.
customer_reviews.author: MaDMomma

customer_reviews.title: Best value and very durable
customer_reviews.text: I am a 61 year old woman, who wanted to get rid of my Bermuda lawn and replace with zoysia sod (many reasons, including the lack of having to mow as often and less watering once established). I bought this tiny tiller, tilled up my entire 10,000 square foot yard, raked and scalped all the Bermuda, then sodded 5 pallets by myself. I could not have had such a beautiful result without the tiller. great piece of machinery for a small framed person like me, but worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly King

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: But does to tell my garden work great and this little machine is extremely powerful. Once assembled the handle is not sturdy I read another review someone used hose clamps I tried this it made the machine so much better to use so I suggest getting hose clamps four of them to help support the joints. I had to return the unit because I tried to unplug from my extension cord And a plug-in from the unit broke off in my extension cord. Other than that it was a great machine
customer_reviews.author: Devo S

customer_reviews.title: An 8 pound barbell weight strapped on it made a very good performance difference
customer_reviews.text: As some other reviewers noted, needs more wight on to to hold down. An 8 pound barbell weight strapped on it made a very good performance difference. The pipes do need the plumbers pipe clamps where they connect for added strength as some other reviewer also remarked, or they could bend- the unit has a lot of power and with these modifications works well.
customer_reviews.author: Craig E.

customer_reviews.title: If at first you don't succeed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of multiple good ratings on various stores. Product arrived, I assembled it (which involves attaching the two-piece handle, everything is pre-wired) and plugged it in...and NOTHING. Turned out I had to mess with the safety interlock on the control...after many tries, the thing finally functioned correctly and I was able to get it to work. I am impressed at the power and what it can do. Like any tiller, it will beat you to a pulp, but I am very happy with this purchase and my only complaint is that it did not work on the first try. That is the reason for four instead of five stars.
customer_reviews.author: CorgiPop

customer_reviews.title: It's a beast but easy to use, love it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm 60 years young and use this very easily. It's a beast for sure, it rips through this yard and super easy to assemble. 4 bolts with locking knob nuts, you don't even need a screwdriver. I love this rototiller....easy to assemble, easy to use and does a fabulous job. I read a review that said it didn't work on hard Wyoming dirt but this should work if you water the ground and let it dry some before tilling so you're not in mud. My soil was a little moist below the surface. I have hard clay type soil and without moisture this dirt is like concrete.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The power of gas for a fraction of the price.
customer_reviews.text: I'm super impressed with this tiller. I bought it because at $129 it was the same price as renting a similar sized gas model for 3 days. I didn't have very high expectations considering its plug in but I was totally wrong. This unit is every bit as powerful as a gas tiller. As other reviewers have mentioned, weeds and things do get wrapped around the shaft pretty easily but they are fairly easy to clear if you don't let it get totally clogged. This tiller has saved me a load of time. So far I have tilled about 4,000 sf to prep for grass seed. This was a great purchase and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Gunslinger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, awesome buy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I just bought it for my husband because he wanted to go rent one for the day for like 80 bucks. Since he had already rented one and it did absolutely nothing for our super hard and packed down soil (it literally didn’t even get half an in deep!) I decided to just buy one instead. SUN JOE IS AMAZING. We got down to at least 2 inches so we can plant the grass and hopefully finally get some grass! I told him this had really good reviews and he didn’t have faith in me but I think I still ended up being more shocked than he was about how well it worked. Just get it!
customer_reviews.author: Johana

customer_reviews.title: Know it’s limitations.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent little tiller for the backyard garden or flowerbeds. Soils must be free of rocks and trigs or you will be stopping to dislodge them from the times. I would like to have adjustable time spacing. It cut through the dirt about an inch to two inches at a time. You will need to make numerous passes to prepare the soil. I’ve been using mine to shred the leaf and grass mulch from the Fall to prepare for Spring planting. It does a good job of aeration of the decomposing materials. I am happy with the machine.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Missing Holes
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed I had to return this. I opened the box to assemble and discovered that where you connect the handle on one side had no holes. One side was perfectly machined, tapered, and had screw holes. The other side was just a solid pole and unable to connect the handle. I had to return it. Completely ruined my long weekend plans to get work done in my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle M

customer_reviews.title: Why pay more?
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! I'm developing 2 acres of native montana land with lots of bushes and pine trees and I didn't think I'd be able to use this for the garden. My plan was just to skim surface where I want to plant grass seed but this is so great it did my garden plot lickity split and did the skimming for grass too good. Bunch grass. Roots. Duff. Rocks. My 12 year old can use it. I did have to cut roots off and clean it out every once in awhile. It got a few rocks jammed in it but my 14 yr old son just pried them out and it fired right up again.
customer_reviews.author: Dubtub

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts on brand new packaging
customer_reviews.text: Contacted Sun Joe to see if I could get parts quickly, as there were supposed to be 4 screws/nuts but there were only 3, and it will take up to 10 business days to get them!! What a joke. How can a company sell a brand new product, and then when it arrived missing parts, not be able to expedite the parts! They said, this is the normal "warranty process", but this is a flawed packaging problem. I hope Sun Joe figures out their operations business, I have their pressure washer and love it.
customer_reviews.author: sabinanners

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller for a city sized garden
customer_reviews.text: Living in a city our garden isn't large at 30' X 10' . The tiller worked perfectly for our sized garden. No more gasoline and engines to mess with. The tiller is very usable for a 75 year old. Easy to assemble, light enough I can handle it and functional enough that it did a super job of tilling our garden. I was a little doubtful about an electric tiller but it did great at tilling the soil down about 9" on the medium setting. If you use it for what it is and don't try to till a super large area this would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Maintenance Only; You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: Used this tiller for a new garden, about 12x12ft. It took forever. Tiller does not cut through sod! You have to break up or remove the sod completely. Tiller doesn't go very deep either and ground must be VERY DRY! If there is any moisture in the dirt then the tiller will jam up and you have to remove the mud from the tiller by hand. Best to use as a maintenance tool and not for new gardens. Pros: does kick up small rocks easily
customer_reviews.author: Keagan Guy

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I bought this last fall but really started using it this Spring. This does the job well. Digs deep in no time flat. I would have given it 5 stars for maneuverability, but by nature the electric cord is a pain in the a*s and you have to keep it in mind on going. I find it worth the trouble as a trade for weight, maintenance, and price.
customer_reviews.author: J Walter

customer_reviews.title: A work horse!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect much when I ordered this rototiller. I was just hoping for something that didn't need gas and could turn over my raised garden beds each Spring. After opening the box, I found it extremely easy to assemble. It also turned over my garden beds without a problem. What surprised me was how easy it tilled a section of ground that had not been previously turned over and was full of roots from old evergreen bushes. It cut through those roots like a hot knife through butter. I'm looking forward to creating future veggie and flower beds around my yard.
customer_reviews.author: Sox4Life

customer_reviews.title: Goodbye gas tiller!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after I spent $80 on parts to refurbish my 2-cycle tiller and it still won't start. I'm done. Saw this and ordered it. Easy to set up. Have three geographically separated gardens and did all three in under 40 minutes yesterday. Tills deep leaving soil fluffy and ready for planting. I use paper and cardboard boxes to cover around the plants to hold water and reduce the need for weeding during the growing season. This tiller eats right through the leftover material. Eat away worms. Did a great job. Goodbye gas ttiller!
customer_reviews.author: G. Tarbet

customer_reviews.title: More powerful than the big old gas beast it replaced.
customer_reviews.text: Starting my third year with this "toy" and it's tilled the old garden, broke sod for a new one, worked up soil for a neighbor and loosened up a patch of stony ground so I could rake the stones out and seed grass there. It hasn't been treated gently at all! At first I was a little hesitant because the motor does heat up a bit, but it must be built very well because it' still running fine. The only minor thing I've had to watch out for is the electrical cord getting in the way, but I'm pretty used to making sure I don't run over it now :) .
customer_reviews.author: Edward S.

customer_reviews.title: Wow, why did I wait so long to purchase this?
customer_reviews.text: This small tiller out did my expectations! Electric yard tools have improved soo much and this one is proof. I tilled my entire garden area with it, and it did not overheat or give me any trouble the very first time I used it. I use it to cultivate and it's size makes that easy! Being electric you don't have to disturb the entire neighbor hood cranking up the old rototiller! I highly recommend this tiller and believe you will be pleasantly surprised with it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: M Morgensen

customer_reviews.title: SO MUCH EASIER ON THE OPERATOR
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely LOVE this tiller. I am disabled and was afraid I would not be able to garden this year. This little, litght weight till is the best. Strong and powerful yet light enough to handle. Turns and pulverized even the clay soil here in Louisiana WITHOUT pulverizing me like a larger, heavier machine does. I definitely recommend this tiller.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W.

customer_reviews.title: Struggled to cut through, gas tiller recommended.
customer_reviews.text: This tiller was not tough enough to cut through my land by any means. I had to fight it harshly in order to get 2 inches tilled. If I let it go it would through dust up but nothing more. If you want the job done right without back breaking fighting get a gas tiller with proper tilling blades. If you’re getting this for a garden area this would be a good fit, unless your garden is quite large. Even then I’d take a one blade gas tiller over this any day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Rototiller for Large Gardens!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this item because we couldn't find a gas one during the pandemic and were in desperate need of getting our large garden ready for planting and couldn't even find one to rent! More than half of the garden is unused lawn. We turned the top layer of grass then used the Sun Joe. It went through it just like a gas one would have! The soil is finely cultivated and the machine did not show any distress at all! We are so very happy that we decided to take a chance on this item!! We'll never have to rent a heavy gas one again! Do yourself a favor and get one of these! you won't be sorry!!
customer_reviews.author: Donna M. Wisniowski

customer_reviews.title: Works well for small garden plots
customer_reviews.text: Great for my small flower garden, even though there was some thick clay in there. Easy to control how deep you want to go - I even went forward and backward (I think the directions say you can't or shouldn't), so I could move it all over - left, right, forward, and backward. I have a 3 feet wide (75 feet long) flower bed and this helped me mix in peat, manure, perlite, and soil amendments. Easy to operate. This would be insufficient for a huge garden plot.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tiller
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tiller for the price and the fact it is electric powered. It was kicking rocks out like sand and ground through some thick roots with no problem. It cleared a 15 x 50 foot section of carpet grass and weeds ground into nice rolled ground ready to plant tomatoes (after amendments which I mixed up with the tiller) in about 20 minutes. The only thing that slows it down are when excessive roots wrap around the blades. It took longer to get the roots off the blades than it did to till the entire area.
customer_reviews.author: Forensic Evaluation

customer_reviews.title: Let it ride forward, pull it back towards you to do the work.
customer_reviews.text: I just had to spread 16 yards of topsoil over an old concrete carport that had been ripped out. This thing did the trick! Not only did it help us aerate the ground underneath the concrete (trapped and compacted for 60 years), it also helped to spread and mix in the new soil. I'd recommend this for both amending or turning over existing soil, and breaking new ground (with the tines as deep as possible (i.e. the wheels as high up as possible), and also making sure that you do the most work when you pull back towards you.
customer_reviews.author: Britt Smith

customer_reviews.title: saved my back
customer_reviews.text: removed a bush due to yellow jacket nest however the soil was a blend of clay, tons of rocks and mulch. Using this was amazing but you do need to really tighten up as this does bounce around a lot. I would consider adding weights to this but it may bog it down. It did great breaking apart stones/rocks and honestly my back is thanking me. I do wish it ground up the soil to be a bit finer but that may be another product.
customer_reviews.author: Patryk

customer_reviews.title: This rototiller is the best! I was going to rent one but for ...
customer_reviews.text: This rototiller is the best! I was going to rent one but for $100 a day I thought this $119 investment made more sense. I'm 100 pounds of mighty so I figured it would be hard to handle and take days of tilling. I was amazed to find that I was able to till my entire yard easily. I've now used it to work in soil amendments, go through clay soil, and till in pea gravel. Don't let the price fool you, this is a powerful and easy to use rototiller.
customer_reviews.author: MariantheLibrarian

customer_reviews.title: Made the garden easy
customer_reviews.text: I talked my husband into getting this for the garden. He used to do it by hand, working the dirt up, etc. Now he says he's glad I talked him into it. He really likes this little tiller. Made fast work of getting the soil ready to plant. He has MS and trouble with one of his legs and he can handle this easily. What used to take him a week to do only took him about an hour and does the soil much better than when he did it manually. The price was good also.
customer_reviews.author: Debi F.

customer_reviews.title: Handy Rototiller
customer_reviews.text: Nice for weed maintenance in the garden rows. I have a large 30 inch cut BCS rototiller that I use for turning over the soil at the beginning of the year. My garden is 150 feet wide by 100 feet long which requires a large rototiller. But I can't use it during the growing season because it is too big and the garden rows are too narrow. The Sun Joe rototiller is perfect for this later rototilling. It does a nice job for weed and grass control!
customer_reviews.author: woodcutter457

customer_reviews.title: little tiller...gets the job DONE!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tiller for what it is. Gets down and dirty easily and breaks up the ground with little effort. Two caveats, first it is very light and would benefit from more weight , insofar as down force. Second, roots tend to wind around the shafts. Other than that it works really good. I was going to try a large gas powered tiller but with the small area we cultivate I decided to give this a try and BOOM! EXACTLY what I needed.. thumbs up sun joe.
customer_reviews.author: Storm75

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to level off a few spots in the yard and to put in a retaining wall and take out the bottom 2 feet of earth. My hope was that it might survive this and get tossed. It worked incredibly well and beat on it hard. I do not dig in my yard or use a shovel as too many rocks. This pulled them out and used my pinch bar to remove the bigger ones. A few medium size stones got caught in the machine - my fault. Just used a hammer and banged them out. Saved me hours and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: NH Wildcat

customer_reviews.title: BEAST MODE
customer_reviews.text: I told everyone in my family that I had bought an electric tiller to plant grass seed. They told me I would smoke this thing and would have to buy a gas-powered one. WRONG! This thing works better than a gas-powered tiller of equal size. Now that being said, you need to buy the right extension cord and during operation, you need to ensure that the motor is not running too hot. Other than that this thing is golden. I also can attest that another review that said adding hose clamps would increase the rigidity of the machine. I can agree with this as well. If you are on the fence about getting this thing, don't be. It is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: This was SUPER easy to assemble (believe me, if I can do it, ANYONE can...took about five minutes)....Probably best for a backyard kind of use as opposed to any real acreage, but so far has been very effective in churning and breaking up fairly hard-packed dirt and churning weeds under....Not good for long weeds though-they eventually wrap and tangle in the blades. Overall a good purchase for a very cheap price.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small tiller to turn the soil in our garden. It is a small garden, but doing it by hand was very time consuming. I got this to save both time and my back. It worked like a charm. Easily cut through the soil and turned it over nice and deep. Was able to get down about 7" or so. Had plenty of power for me needs. I like electric tools of this nature as they are much easier to use season to season. I have several other Sun Joe products and all have held us very well over the years. If you need a tiller for smaller jobs this is a perfect choice.
customer_reviews.author: C. Marois

customer_reviews.title: China Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is garbage, missing peices. The handles are not sturdy, returned. Went to the store and bought a name brand one. Ryobi makes a great one. Don't buy this, you will regret it. I don't write reviews unless I get Garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Jason J.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful tool for the garden!
customer_reviews.text: I have a small backyard garden and built raised beds a few years ago. I had previously used a 5 hp. gas tiller but at my age (69) it had become more than I could handle physically. Plus pulling on that rope when it was ornery. This replacement is lightweight with a powerful little motor. Just right for my physical abilities and with the small size of my garden it really does the job! Wish I had bought it sooner. I don’t think you will be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Redneck Papaman

customer_reviews.title: Most Excellent
customer_reviews.text: You aren't going to till up a ten acre field with this unit, but for garden containers and relatively rock-free soil it's handy, agile, and lightweight. Last I counted I have twelve or thirteen internal combustion engines to maintain, so the quiet, maintenance-free electric option is most welcome. Customer service is superb.. I had the misfortune of snagging a stone that jammed and cracked the gearbox. Warranty replacement was offered within 24 hours via email. Two (green) thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. I am constantly working in my yard and have a horrible clay dirt in California. I was killing myself for years trying to redo my garden beds and finally broke down and bought one of these. It's the best thing I ever purchased. I'm 130 lb woman and it's very easy to use I highly highly recommend it can't wait to do the other areas of my garden save me hours of time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wheel Fell Off
customer_reviews.text: We've been working on our yard and looking forward to using the tiller. Unpacking and assembly took about 15 minutes. Started using it and, within 5 minutes, the wheel fell-off due to a lock washer that came loose. Additionally, there was a missing flat washer. While minor, it was frustrating to stop and repair a brand new unit. I called customer service, left a call back number, and no one returned the call. On a positive note, it's a powerful lightweight tool which works well on slightly dampened soil. First impressions are lasting, so I couldn't give it a high rating. Customer service will be the deciding factor in giving a higher rating on a future update.
customer_reviews.author: Opinion Pole

customer_reviews.title: Juggernaut
customer_reviews.text: I don't have any dislikes that cannot be anticipated. It has a cord, it sometimes clogs, etc. Despite tangles the blades always kept turning for me. I only cleared them to improve the efficiency of the tiller. I bought the 10 amp version and it works exactly as advertised. It churns away and will not stop for much of anything. It sometimes bounces around on hard ground so you need to exercise a little muscle but it is doing that job that I was dreading doing by hand. Assembly was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Fiveliterfalcon

customer_reviews.title: This tiller is a beast for a little light electric tiller!
customer_reviews.text: The natural soil in my yard is hard packed clay with river rocks and gravel... This little guy tears right into it. You better have strong arms and firm grip HOLD ON! It does bounce when it hits medium to large rocks. I used to the tiller to loosen my soil so I could put down hardware cloth to deter the gofer's from eating everything in my yard.. Very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this in the mail....the postal delivery girl wanted the details as she’s going to buy one too! Took maybe 20 minutes to put it together “with NO TOOLS needed! OK....hit the garden which is a raised bed of topsoil and barn dirt. Raised the back wheels....and this thing went to China! Or tried to! Very powerful. Tears those barn clods apart fast! Left me with nice, loamy soil. I am very, very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Ward

customer_reviews.title: Stunned at how well this thing works!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased specifically to turn over a unhealthy front lawn to it could be reseeded. I was reluctant to spend a lot on what might be a "one off" use, but was also concerned it would fail immediately upon digging into our very rocky soil. My concerns were unfounded. This beast dug through the soil, flung REALLY big stones, and never missed a beat. I can honestly say I was impressed !
customer_reviews.author: JMW

customer_reviews.title: Very pleasantly surprised!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with low expectations, wanted a Mantis but it was out of my price range. This thing is a joy to use, and it sounds like a kitchen blender which makes me giggle whenever I use it. The only drawback is if you get a rock stick in it, you might have to take the blades off, as it's electric and the blades don't turn freely when shut off. Has plenty of power for tilling my 30x60 foot veggie garden. I like that I can stop and start back up again without pull starting. If it lasts a year, its paid for itself!
customer_reviews.author: Abby512

customer_reviews.title: Simply an awesome machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a one-time project of leveling a 12’x12’ square for a patio. To bring it level required digging down almost a foot. This burrowed down without any issues (except when you hit big roots; they have to be cut out by hand.) And given the price, I didn’t know whether this would hold up for the job but it did! Great piece of equipment and a value for its price.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Meck

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful motor that never bogged down
customer_reviews.text: I got to hand it to Sun Joe, this tiller is a beast. I got an excellent workout from this tiller, I didn't think it was going to be as powerful as it was. My backyard is about 900 square feet and I tilled up the ground going several directions in about 15 hours. My dirt was hard compact dirt full of Bermuda and St Augustin grass roots. Never bogged down!
customer_reviews.author: Scott M

customer_reviews.title: I am impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I have never used an electric tiller before. I was told they do not have enough power. I read good reviews on this one so I gave it a try. I have used it a few times this spring/summer and it works great! Its not heavy so my wife will use it too. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Jason Fox

customer_reviews.title: amazing customer service for a really good product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to till my 1/8 acre backyard in preparation for new sod. The machine was on constantly for 3 days and worked well for tilling. For $100, this would have already covered the typical cost to rent a tiller. So pretty much at that price, it's already paid for itself. So when it threw a bearing, I was just going to call it a day. But when I told Joe Snow about the bearing, they send me a brand new tiller. What a great company that stand behind the product. This is a great machine. And great customer service when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Best Small Tiller We've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: This little tiller is absolutely amazing! I wasn't sure it would really be very good, but we can't get our large tiller into the raised beds (we're not that strong!) But this little guy is easy to pick up and set in the raised bed and does a fabulous job of churning up compost and mixing it into the soil. It breaks up the clods well (much better than hand digging) and makes a nice fluffy bed for seeds. The Sun Joe has much more power than we anticipated, is easy to clean up afterward and not so blasted loud as the big gas powered tiller we have. I think next spring the big tiller will find a new home.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous, powerful little machine.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous little machine. I had a full size gas powered rotortiller that wasn't working so I decided it would be cheaper to purchase this one then repair the old one. I am thrilled with my decision. I have 2 fairly large gardens, 30x50 and this little machine goes through them in record time. I thought it would be harder and take longer then with my old machine but that is not true. My first till of the year, I did go through each garden twice so I could go deep enough but it was so fast is still took me half the time that it did with the old one. I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Electric Tiller
customer_reviews.text: this tiller came in before the deadline and works GREAT.....it can till up dirt like there's no tomorrow.....VERY FAST AND POWERFUL....HANG ON TIGHT.....IT DOES THE JOB FOR SURE!!!!! I LOVE my new tiller and use it everywhere in my yard; so much that I dug up a part of my parents yard next door for them to have a garden....and it STILL keeps on going....IT IS AN AWESOME TILLER.... for an ELECTRIC TILLER, THIS TILLER stands up against 'practically' ANY GAS POWERED tillers, I K I D Y O U N O T.....if you get it, you WILL NOT be disappointed....thank you Sun Joe...
customer_reviews.author: Greattech05

customer_reviews.title: Awesome !!
customer_reviews.text: This tiller makes prepping a lawn for sod a breeze ! It took five minutes to assemble and I was done tilling and prepping a 12' X 6' section of lawn to plant sod in ten minutes. Very powerful and easy to maneuver. The dirt was packed and very hard. This tiller pulverized the hard clods and made the soil very smooth.
customer_reviews.author: AA AMT

customer_reviews.title: Cheap plastic wheels but tills decent
customer_reviews.text: Well after about 20 minutes of tilling then resetting the wheels to take back inside one of the wheels fell off. Called customer service and they were kinda rude and had me pry to wheel apart to fix a c clip that was broke . I asked about a new wheel where I had to pry the wheel apart and got no satisfaction .. did dona good job tillin a 12x12 garden I am making for my son and still contemplating on if I should return if I had such bad customer service with just a plastic wheel what if something else goes wrong ?
customer_reviews.author: K. Obrien

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a Mantis gas tiller with this one. I love how easy this is to start. Just plug it in and start tilling. All I had to do was take it out of the box, put the handles together and I was ready to use it. It's not quite as powerful as the Mantis but did a good job tilling the gardens. Also, it is wider than the Mantis which makes getting into tight spaces a little harder. However, this is about 1/2 the price of the Mantis and did a good job so overall I'm very pleased. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M Prather

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tiller
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly powerful. I tilled up a half acre of red Georgia clay (basically cement) in a days worth of work and dug a 10 inch deep drainage ditch too. Pretty easy to keep the cord behind you without a helper. Easy to dislodge roots and vines when they get caught in the blades. The electric mower takes a beating and keeps on tilling. Low noise-sounds like a small vacuum cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lyon Layden

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have. We had about 6-9 inches of just a rats nest of weed roots to get up. The machine worked better than expected. Since we weren’t tilling grass, we had to clear out the blades after each 6 ft run. Took longer than anticipated but worked just as well as the tiller we rented from the equipment store and was at the same price as a four hour rental. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Donegan

customer_reviews.title: Great for weeding and flower beds.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't expecting much but I'm on my third year using this and I can't complain. I hardly use a hoe in my garden, I just plug in the sun joe and till between plants and rows. I am thinking about adding a "mud flap" to the back, as it really throws the dirt. I still use my big gas tiller in the fall and spring but use the Sun Joe for flower beds and my vegetable garden as needed.
customer_reviews.author: kayo

customer_reviews.title: It's beast
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to experiment with the depth/wheel settings if it's your first time using a tiller. There are 3 settings. Don't make the mistake to set what you think is the deepest setting which is actually the lowest setting (least deep). For the longest time I thought I was going as deep as it could but it was really as shallow as it could. So experiment with the settings in safe spot.
customer_reviews.author: UserUnnamed

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I bought it 1 year ago, stored it in the garage over the winter, just took it out and it worked for less than 1 minute. Now nothing. I checked the extension cord and outlet to make sure there is power. The tines are clear, the soil has already been tilled by a gas tiller. I was just going over it again to work some compost and fertilizer in and it died.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilkins

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, lightweight
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good tiller, especially for the price. It'll go around 8-10 inches easily, further if you move the dirt out of the way and go for a second round. It's very simple to use- plugging it in and pulling a switch, and holding it down to continue. The switch is also a good safety feature, as if you let it go even for a second, the tiller will stop.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Clover

customer_reviews.title: Tiller is a Thriller
customer_reviews.text: This tiller is so fantastic. Easy to assemble and when safety guidelines are followed, extremely easy to use. I tilled my back yard in preparation for a huge hardscaping project and the soil was perfect when the construction crew came on-site -- no grass, easy to shovel, and no big rocks or debris to mess with -- because of the tilling I did beforehand.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Kristina L. Maze

customer_reviews.title: Nice Small Garden Tiller
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly and good instructions. Easy storage on my garage wall as well. Quite the powerhouse for its size. I tilled a clay area with lots of roots and the occasional rock to prepare the soil for a 16 foot by 2 foot raised garden. The Sun Joe knocked it out easily. It handled the rocks and roots just fine. I did clear the roots from the tines periodically so the motor would not be overworked. Another great Sun Joe tool that lived up to its promise!
customer_reviews.author: FES

customer_reviews.title: Awesome choice for small gardens and yard projects
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Sun Joe product and again I was very satisfied with the price, value, and performance of this tiller. I needed to replace sod on my neighbor's yard where I had removed a Pompass Grass stand. This tiller easy dug through the soil and made it fluffy and idea for lay my sod. I was surprised when it uncovered a piece of rebar property marker and kept on chugging. I have other tillers just bounce around but this Lil guy took to the task well. Great for small gardens.
customer_reviews.author: Dawgfan57

customer_reviews.title: More powerful than you'd think!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tiller for the price range and good reviews. We used it to "till" compressed clay/sand that normally takes a pick mattoc to cut thru. Using multiple passes we dug 2 ditches 24 inches wide 12 inches deep and 18 feet long. We shoveled out the loose dirt(and broken chunks of concrete) after each pass and pulled out close to 2 cubic yards of bad soil. It is very light so it can be jumpy on hard soil. If you plan on using this as a garden tiller itll get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This little tiller has a lot of power, and dug deep!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to till my mothers raised garden bed. It has been very difficult to till the bed using the larger tillers that we rented. This little tiller did the trick. It was easy to put together, simple to work, and once I raised the wheels up, the tiller really dug down deep into the soil in the raised bed. It was difficult to maneuver inside the raised bed, trying not to hit the sides, but that is an issue with any tiller. Powerful, simple to use. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: pboy

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Had More to Till!
customer_reviews.text: When my hubby said the yard had to be tilled before new sod could be laid, I thought, “Great, this is going to take forever.” We ordered the Sun Joe and when I saw him using it, I was like, “This looks cool! Outta my way!” This thing is awesome!! It is easy to maneuver and it does an amazing job!! It worked so well it didn’t take me anytime to finish. I was literally looking for other areas to till! :D Hubby’s review: So easy even the wife can use it! I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie R.

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Not a product for someone looking to be able to start a garden, if you have one the needs to be just retiled, it might be able to do the job, waste of money, and mine came with missing parts, so it wasn't the best experience,
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a cheaper alternative to gas powered tillers to fix a few spots in my yard. I am now using it to do many more projects. It is quiet and powerful. No drag......unless you hit a large root. Cuts deep. Heavy grasses will get wound around the tines so you do have to clean them occasionally. I would recommend this tiller if you are on the fence about what to buy. It is light but sturdy, and easy to assemble and clean. You wont regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Untangle to much!
customer_reviews.text: It is light weight, and powerful. I am a 49 yr old female and it runs forward and i have to pull it back, thats how it works. But every 5 minutes I would have to stop and untangle grass roots. some times would have to take the blades off to clean it. I think maybe it was not made right. That was crazy!!!!! returned it. Got a used gas tiller worked so much better and hardly any clean off, but it was to powerful for me had husband do it. That is sad.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Garden Tool addition
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this based on reviews her on Amazon. Arrived as stated, assembled it ready and WOW, this is a powerful little garden tool. It does what it says and easily cuts new garden from a grass lawn with no problem. It chews it way through the soil and mixes any additional fertilizer into the soil. Highly recommend addition to a Gardeners Tools.
customer_reviews.author: Donald E. Blowes

customer_reviews.title: Great tiller for smaller gardens
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this tiller to put in a small garden this summer. It works great. We had a big garden tiller in the past so I wasn't expecting too much. I was very suprised how well it did. I would recommend to anyone that has a small to medium garden. It has come in handy to use between the rows when the weeds started to come in. Surprisingly efficient!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jill E Potter

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but this is a great little tiller! Be prepared to go take a few passes to get things cultivated on some ground--especially hard packed ground or soil with lots of clay. And while it's certainly light weight, it may be a little too light sometimes--if you hit rocks, it'll buck off to the left or right pretty hard, so keep a tight grip!
customer_reviews.author: Karl Ardo

customer_reviews.title: Beyond expectations
customer_reviews.text: I have rented the super-size gas tillers in the past. My purchase of this electric tiller is with the acceptance that electric motors under strain burn up. So expectation for this electric tiller was to be pampered and slow working. Not so at all. I did allow it to do all the work without forcing it. And it responded. I will continue to respect the nature of the electric motor and not push beyond its own doing. I would not hesitate to recommend this tiller to others.
customer_reviews.author: KaptainRandom

customer_reviews.title: An excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have a gas powered rototiller that is effective, but overkill for flower beds and narrow cultivated strips. Also, I have quite a bit of ground on a side hill, and I’ve reached the age that horsing the large tiller around is too much. This Sun Joe tiller is perfect for what I need. It’s light and powerful. It isn’t as fast as the gas machine, but it will keep digging to any reasonable depth—plenty for planting. I have no hesitation on recommending it.
customer_reviews.author: James H. Green

customer_reviews.title: Great performance. Impressed with this tiller!
customer_reviews.text: Impressed with everything about this tiller. We’ve use it several times now and it pulls up small roots and medium-size roots in our yard beautifully. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Small town girl

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Like others, I was skeptical of the power and durability with it being an electric machine. My concerns were tossed out the window after the first use. It has ample power and gets the job done. Easily adjustable and is definitely portable. It has no problem on tough ground or with rocks the size of an average potato. Made the mistake of bragging about it to friends and already have them lining up to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin M

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for small garden
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic tool for the small garden. I didn’t have high hopes for this machine but thought I would give it a try. Glad I did. The only downside is having to keeping the cord clear of tiller. It’s lightweight and I didn’t want to deal with a heavy gas machine so this is perfect. It’s also very compact for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Rick L.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace a name brand gas mini tiller that would always give me issues since I let it set up since I don't use them often. The Sun Joe worked great and had more power than the gas one. I thought it would be a pain to pull out the extension cord but for the limited time I use one well worth it. I used it on our small 14x16 garden and a flower bed I redid this year. This thing really moved the dirt. So far great product.
customer_reviews.author: Trudi A. Hutton

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Maybe the best $100 I've spent on Amazon. Tilled a compacted soil/sand mixed end-of-summer yard that was sodded about 10 years ago and is about 300 sq ft. It efficiently pulled out the sod mesh which of course got wrapped around the tines, but did not decrease the function and was relatively easily removed with scissors and knife. It would kick out 3" rocks or so and go thru 1/2-1" roots with little problem. The silver (aluminum?) Housing gets pretty warm so one might need to give it a rest periodically. If our new clover yard fails over winter/spring, I'll be happy to dig it out again! It also doesn't take up much space in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: JEREMY holt

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had found this years ago!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot say how much I enjoy having this tool in my garage. The tines unbolt easily for quick cleaning, the 12 amp motor doesn't slow down for anything, and it's light/easy to manuever. I've tilling up a lot of heavily rooted dirt and it keeps asking for more! I'd recommend sharpening the tines if you're breaking up ground that has a lot of roots, it'll help with keeping them from tangling around the spindle. Also, be sure to check for tangles and caking so the motor doesn't over heat or burn up. I haven't had this problem, just a little FYI.
customer_reviews.author: Rascal

customer_reviews.title: Good for tilling...not so good in tight spaces.
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job breaking up dirt and digging out weeds in my garden bed. And it did a decent enough job aerating the bare spots in my lawn so I can put seed down. My only complaint would be the inability to see exactly where I was tilling. I had rented gas powered Mantis tillers in the past from Home Depot and I could always see exactly where the blades were. The guard on this Sun Joe model is too large and I wound up ripping into two perennial plants trying to till around them.
customer_reviews.author: Christie B.

customer_reviews.title: Really Quite Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: This is the tiller that won't quit. We picked out a new place for a garden and found that it was a rock garden. Little by little we are getting the rocks out with the help of this little tiller. Once they are out, the tiller churns the dirt into powder. Hard packed clay is no match for the tiller. It's tines cut into the dirt at a rapid pace and chew it up. The motor seems more than powerful enough for any challenge. Quite a bargain!
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Webster

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect to till a large garden with it.
customer_reviews.text: This is a fabulous tiller if you are needing something for a small space. Works well. My wife loves it. She uses it for the small planter boxes, chicken coop, and other tight spaces. For al arge garden use a large tiller or tractor. Otherwise you will be out there all day. Easy to clean doesn't take much space. Recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lazarus

customer_reviews.title: A great tiller
customer_reviews.text: This little guy is a jewel! Over many years, I have owned several gas-powered rototillers, all much bigger that this one. I like the torque that an electric motor delivers. It is very different from a gas engine. With gas, when the tiller bogs down and slows, the torque is diminished. With an electric motor, the torque increases as the rotation speed decreases. That difference makes this little workhorse a great tool While too small for a large area, this tiller is perfect for my vegetable gardens
customer_reviews.author: M. Sabes

customer_reviews.title: 2nd growing season
customer_reviews.text: I am nowhere near a gardener, I play in the dirt to see what happens. With that said, I can't wait to get back outside to put the plow to dirt. Makes it so easy on my bad back (6 discs removed, screws, rods, spacers, fusions blah, blah, blah) thanks Uncle Sam. So if you are in my lane get one, get outside, get moving and get growing... something (lol).
customer_reviews.author: Kasey J

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tiller as a super quick purchase as we needed to get our garden planted. My husband was initially against getting an electric tiller, but due to the positive reviews, he decided to try this one out. It is SO AMAZING!. Super light and easy to use and does such a nice job of breaking up stubborn dirt.
customer_reviews.author: BKDavis

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of Power
customer_reviews.text: I specifically purchased this model because it didn't require an especially hefty (and expensive) extension cord to operate safely. Of course, my concern was that it would be under-powered. If you are tempted to spend more so that you aren't buying trash, just save your money. I am an avid gardener and this tiller has the feel of something that I can use on a regular basis and still have it outlive me.
customer_reviews.author: David Dunaway

product_meta.title: Sun Joe TJ603E 16-Inch 12-Amp Electric Tiller and Cultivator
product_meta.description: THE DIRTY LITTLE SECRET OF GREAT GARDENS. Dig it - and experience the one tiller that's truly up to the task! Introducing a greener, cleaner way to get dirty with the Sun Joe TILLER JOE TJ603E Electric Tiller + Cultivator. A powerful 12-amp motor quickly pulverizes dirt, effortlessly slicing through the soil at 340 RPM, ensuring maximum aeration and perfectly preparing the seedbed for planting. Cultivate an area 16-Inch wide and up to 8-Inch deep in seconds. Control weeds where needed - TILLER JOE tames the toughest yard and garden tasks with more comfort and less strain. Rear wheels make it easy to maneuver wherever it's needed - and its collapsible handle makes it a cinch to store when it's not. The TJ603E comes with a full two-year .
feature_bullets: Powerful: 12-amp motor cultivates up to 16 in. (40. 6 cm) wide x 8 in. (20. 3 cm) deep
Durable: 6 Steel angled tines for maximum durability and performance
Easy storage: handle folds for convenient storage and easy transport; voltage (V): 120

We’ve got you covered! : your new Tiller + cultivator is backed by the snow Joe + Sun Joe customer promise. We will warrant New, powered products for two years from the date of purchase. No questions asked. Contact snow Joe + Sun Joe customer Support at 1-866-766-9563 for further assistance.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars3,246 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
